TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Setter extends System.Windows.SetterBase implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
Public Class Setter Inherits SetterBase Implements ISupportInitialize
type Setter = class inherit SetterBase interface ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Represents a setter that applies a property value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Style>s and the different types of triggers (classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.TriggerBase>) use <xref:System.Windows.Setter>s to apply property values.
Note that you must specify both the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Value%2A> properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> for the setter to be meaningful. If one or both properties are not set, an exception will be thrown.
## Examples The following example defines a <xref:System.Windows.Style> that will be applied to every <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock> element. This <xref:System.Windows.Style> applies values to several <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock> properties with the use of <xref:System.Windows.Setter>s.
[!code-xaml[PhotoStoreDemoStyled#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PhotoStoreDemoStyled/CS/window1.xaml#1)]
The following example shows a named <xref:System.Windows.Style> available to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> controls. The <xref:System.Windows.Style> defines a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> element that changes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Foreground%2A> property of a button when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.IsPressed%2A> property is `true`.
[!code-xaml[BtnStyles#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BtnStyles/CS/app.xaml#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property to which the will be applied.
Docs.value: A to which the will be applied. The default value is null.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Note that you must specify both the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Property%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Setter.Value%2A> properties on a <xref:System.Windows.Setter> or an exception will be thrown.
## Examples The following example defines a style that will be applied to every <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock> element.
[!code-xaml[PhotoStoreDemoStyled#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PhotoStoreDemoStyled/CS/window1.xaml#1)]
The following example shows a style declaration that will affect the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control.Background%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control>. Note that property name in this example is qualified with the name of the class (<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Control>) because the <xref:System.Windows.Style> does not specify a <xref:System.Windows.Style.TargetType%2A>.
[!code-xaml[StyleOvw01#StyleSimple](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StyleOvw01/CS/Page1.xaml#stylesimple)]

Docs.param: The object where the markup extension sets the value.
Data that is relevant for markup extension processing.
Docs.summary: Handles cases where a markup extension provides a value for a property of object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the method referenced by an applied <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetMarkupExtensionAttribute> attribute at the class level, which means that this method processes all attempts to set values of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> with a markup extension. You do not typically call this method directly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the method referenced by an applied <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlSetTypeConverterAttribute> attribute at the class level, which means that this method processes all attempts to set values of <xref:System.Windows.Setter> with a type converter. You do not typically call this method directly.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object this is intended for.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set this property to the name of any element within the scope of where the setter collection (the collection that this setter is part of) is applied. This is typically a named element that is within the template that contains this setter.
## Examples In the following example, the <xref:System.Windows.Setter.TargetName%2A> is used for the trigger <xref:System.Windows.Setter> to specify that the <xref:System.Windows.Setter> is intended for the <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse> named `ThumbCover` within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>.
[!code-xaml[ColorPicker_snip#StyleTargetNameRef](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_snip/CSharp/ColorPickerApp/MyApp.xaml#styletargetnameref)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value to apply to the property that is specified by this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *value* An object or a markup extension. See [StaticResource Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/staticresource-markup-extension.md). Note that you must specify both the and properties on a or an exception will be thrown. Data binding and dynamic resources within the object is supported if the specified value is a object. See [Binding Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/binding-markup-extension.md) and [DynamicResource Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dynamicresource-markup-extension.md). ## Examples The following example defines a that will be applied to every element. For the complete example, see [Introduction to Styling and Templating Sample](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160010). [!code-xaml[PhotoStoreDemoStyled#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PhotoStoreDemoStyled/CS/window1.xaml#1)] The following example defines a with s that reference system resources. [!code-xaml[BtnStyles#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BtnStyles/CS/app.xaml#1)] The following example defines a for the . [!code-xaml[ColorPicker_snip#StyleTargetNameRef](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ColorPicker_snip/CSharp/ColorPickerApp/MyApp.xaml#styletargetnameref)] The following example shows a property that uses the declaration. For the complete example, see [Binding Validation Sample](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=159972). [!code-xaml[bindvalidation#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BindValidation/CSharp/Window1.xaml#5)]
